description: A schema that defines basic fields for identifying a person, can be used in combination with other schemas for KYC purposes. This schema is part of the Privado ID Common Schemas Initiative. The schema aligns with the Decentralized Identity Foundation (DIF) Credential Schema standard for Basic Person, although not all fields are supported due to protocol limitations. Basic Person Schema spec at DIF: https://identity.foundation/credential-schemas/#basic-person-schema
title: Basic Person Schema

credentialSubject.description: Stores the data of the credential
credentialSubject.title: Credential subject

id.description: Stores the DID of the subject that owns the credential
id.title: Credential subject ID

fullName.description: End-User's full name in displayable form including all name parts, possibly including titles and suffixes, ordered according to the End-User's locale and preferences.
fullName.title: Full Name

firstName.description: Current first name(s) or given names of the credential subject
firstName.title: First Name

familyName.description: Current family name(s) of the credential subject
familyName.title: Family Name

middleName.description: Middle name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple middle names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters. Also note that in some cultures, middle names are not used.
middleName.title: Middle Name

alsoKnownAs.description: Stage name, religious name or any other type of alias/pseudonym with which a person is known in a specific context besides its legal name. This must be part of the applicable legislation and thus the trust framework (e.g., be an attribute on the identity card).
alsoKnownAs.title: Also Known As

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the credential subject.
dateOfBirth.title: Date Of Birth

govermentIdentifier.description: The unique government or national identifier of the credential subject (constructed by the sending Member State in accordance with the technical specifications for the purposes of cross-border identification and which is as persistent as possible in time).
govermentIdentifier.title: Government Identifier

governmentIdentifierType.description: Type of government or national identifier, allowed values: passport, national id document, tax id, drivers license, social service number (ssn, social issurance number, or health service id), other.
governmentIdentifierType.title: Government identifier type

gender.description: Gender that the credential subject identifies as. Some reference values (non-exhaustive list): male, female, transgender male, transgender female, non-binaryâ€¦.
gender.title: Gender

email.description: End-User's preferred e-mail address. Its value MUST conform to the RFC 5322 [RFC5322] addr-spec syntax.
email.title: Email

sex.description: Biological sex of the individual at birth. Allowed values: male, female.
sex.title: sex

phoneNumber.description: Primary contact number of the user, it should include the country code. The phone number must be formatted according to ITU-T recommendation [E.164], e.g., "1999550123" or "50688785073"
phoneNumber.title: Phone Number

phoneNumberVerified.description: True if the End-User's phone number has been verified; otherwise false. When this Claim Value is true, this means that the OP took affirmative steps to ensure that this phone number was controlled by the End-User at the time the verification was performed. The means by which a phone number is verified is context-specific, and dependent upon the trust framework or contractual agreements within which the parties are operating.
phoneNumberVerified.title: Phone Number Verified (Boolean)

nameAndFamilyNameAtBirth.description: Defines the first and the family name(s) of the credential subject at the time of their birth. Structured as a json object.
nameAndFamilyNameAtBirth.title: Name and Family Name at birth

firstName.description: First name(s) or given names of the credential subject at birth.
firstName.title: First Name

familyName.description: Family name(s) of the credential subject at birth.
familyName.title: Family Name

placeOfBirth.description: Defines the place where the credential subject is born. The value of this is a JSON object.
placeOfBirth.title: Place of Birth

locality.description: Locality: String representing city or locality component.
locality.title: Locality

region.description: region: String representing state, province, prefecture, or region component. This field might be required in some jurisdictions.
region.title: Region

countryCode.description: Country: String representing country in ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 codes (e.g. FRA, USA, CRC).
countryCode.title: Country Code

countryCodeNumber.description: ISO 3166-1 numeric three-digit country code, eg: 250 for France, 840 for United States, 188 for Costa Rica.
countryCodeNumber.title: Country Code Number
